item.title: Socialism or Collapse
item.description: In the spring of 1896, a paper by a Swedish scientist was published in a journal based in London. It was titled, ‘On the Influence of Carbonic Acid in the Air upon the Temperature of the Ground’. The scientist’s name was Svante Arrhenius. It discussed, at a time when the polio vaccine had not yet been developed, how increasing concentrations of carbon dioxide gas (then referred to as ‘carbonic acid’) in the atmosphere could lead to a rise in the average temperature of the earth’s surface.
